snippet: Located in New York City’s Chinatown since 1977, Chinatown Ice Cream Factory is a popular destination, more so in the summer, where one can find more than two dozen flavors.
abstract: Neighborhood Joint column on Chinatown Ice Cream Factory, long, narrow store from which owner Philip Seid serves long lines of customers waiting for scoops of homemade ice cream in flavors ranging from black sesame to lychee and even plain vanilla.
lead_paragraph: Located in New York City’s Chinatown since 1977, Chinatown Ice Cream Factory is a popular destination, more so in the summer, where one can find more than two dozen flavors.

headline.print_headline: Where a Scoop of Durian Is Plain Vanilla
headline.main: Chinatown Ice Cream Factory, Where a Scoop of Durian Is Plain Vanilla
